means: 狼吞虎咽，贪婪地吃，飞碟游戏（比赛双方每组5人，相距15码，互相掷接飞碟）
毁坏（建筑物等）的内部( gut的第三人称单数 )

sentence.Network_en: Most have worked their guts out and made sacrifices.
sentence.Network_cn: 大部分人都拼命工作，作出了很大的牺牲。

sentence.Network_en: The new Chancellor has the guts to push through unpopular tax increases.
sentence.Network_cn: 新总理有勇气推动不受欢迎的增税方案获得通过。

sentence.Network_en: You have to give her top marks for moral guts.
sentence.Network_cn: 你不得不对她维护正义的勇气竖起大拇指。

entry.def: A person's  or animal's guts are all the organs inside them.

example.ex: By the time they finish, the crewmen are standing ankle-deep in fish guts.
example.tran: 到他们完工时，船员站的地方鱼内脏已堆至脚踝。

entry.tran: 取出（动物或鱼）的内脏（以备烹饪）
entry.def: When someone guts a dead animal or fish, they prepare it for cooking by removing all the organs from inside it.

example.ex: It is not always necessary to gut the fish prior to freezing.
example.tran: 冷冻鱼之前并不总是需要先把内脏掏空。

entry.def: The gut is the tube inside the body of a person or animal through which food passes while it is being digested.
Guts is the will and courage to do something which is difficult or unpleasant, or which might have unpleasant results.

example.ex: The new Chancellor has the guts to push through unpopular tax increases...
example.tran: 新总理有勇气推动不受欢迎的增税方案获得通过。

example.ex: It takes more guts than I've usually got to go and see him.
example.tran: 我需要鼓起更大的勇气去见他。

entry.def: A gut feeling is based on instinct or emotion rather than reason.

example.ex: Let's have your gut reaction to the facts as we know them.
example.tran: 请告诉我们你对我们所了解的这些事实的本能反应。

entry.def: You can refer to someone's stomach as their gut, especially when it is very large and sticks out.

example.ex: His gut sagged out over his belt.
example.tran: 他肚子上的赘肉堆在皮带上方。

entry.def: The guts of something, for example a subject or a machine, are the key elements of it, which make it work.

example.ex: She has a reputation for getting at the guts of a subject and never pulling her punches...
example.tran: 她以善抓问题实质、说话一针见血著称。

example.ex: The guts of the reactor have to be hauled out of the pressure vessel.
example.tran: 核反应堆的核心构件必须从压力罩中取出来。

entry.def: To gut a building means to destroy the inside of it so that only its outside walls remain.

example.ex: Over the weekend, a firebomb gutted a building where 60 people lived...
example.tran: 本周，一颗燃烧弹炸毁了一栋有60位居民的楼房。

example.ex: A factory stands gutted and deserted.
example.tran: 一座内部被毁的废置工厂矗立在那里。

entry.tran: （用于制作球拍的网线、小提琴弦等的）肠线
entry.def: Gut is string made from part of the stomach of an animal. Traditionally, it is used to make the strings of sports rackets or musical instruments such as violins.
To bust a gut means to work very hard trying to achieve something.

example.ex: You can bust a gut sixteen hours a day, seven days a week, but if your product is lousy, you've wasted your time.
example.tran: 你可以一周7天、一天16小时地拼命劳作，但是如果产品质量低劣，你就白费时间了。

entry.def: If you hate someone's guts, you dislike them very much indeed.

entry.tran: 告密；把所知和盘托出；倾诉心里话
entry.def: If someone spills their guts, they tell you everything about something secret or private.

example.ex: People call in and just spill their guts about whatever's bothering them on the job or in a relationship.
example.tran: 人们打进电话，就是要将工作或感情上的所有困扰倾诉出来。

entry.def: If you say that you are working your guts out or slogging your guts out, you are emphasizing that you are working as hard as you can.

example.ex: Most have worked their guts out and made sacrifices.
example.tran: 大部分人都拼命工作，作出了很大的牺牲。

sentences.sentence: "he didn't have the guts to try it"

auth_sentence.content: Do we just trust our guts for all decisions?
auth_sentence.res_content: Do we just trust our guts for all decisions?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Do we just trust our guts for all decisions?

auth_sentence.content: He had his guts hanging out of his stomach.
auth_sentence.res_content: He had his guts hanging out of his stomach.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He had his guts hanging out of his stomach.

auth_sentence.content: He was just a lieutenant then this took guts.
auth_sentence.res_content: He was just a lieutenant then this took guts.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He was just a lieutenant then this took guts.
